service.name: Personally Controlled Electronic Health Record
service.description: The Personally Controlled Electronic Health Record (PCEHR) is a secure electronic summary of a consumer's health information. A consumer can: access their eHealth record from anywhere via a website; add their own notes to their eHealth record; allow healthcare professionals to view their eHealth record information and add new information to their record. DHS manages consumer and provider contact information for the Personally Controlled Electronic Health Record (eHealth record) system.  It also provides contact centre capabilities and supporting infrastructures for registrations, enquiries, complaints and advice via phone, face-to-face, mail and online channels.
